list_definition.definition: a plant that has a round dark red root which can be eaten as a vegetable; beet American

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Borscht is a soup made with beetroot

list_ex_of_english: Most cosmetic products available were still either chemically dubious, or found in the kitchen amid food colorings, berries and beetroot.
Crops inclined to bolt include lettuce, beetroot, brassicas, spinach, celery and onion.
Is it anticipated that there will be an increase in the production of beetroot sugar?
Schellweilers lone remaining farm run as a primary income earner grows potatoes, grain and beetroots for sale or livestock fodder.
They bought a 9 square kilometre plot of beetroot farmland, which became the site from which the new city would arise.
Most commonly potatoes, sometimes carrots, beetroots, onions, garlic and marrows were cultivated in the allotments, and in the south melons and watermelons.
Other vegetables used include beetroot and onion.
Beetroot, pineapple and fried onions are also extremely common additions.
